::Fenox::

Fenox watches D walk away from the door and nod at her angry 
question, beginning to feel sorry for yelling at him. She didn't mean 
to sound annoyed, its just that he interrupted her when she was 
dealing with a possible threat.

"Aw, I'm sorry," she says, walking up to him and scratching behind 
his ears, "I didn't mean to get mad. Its just that I was monitoring 
him pretty well."

She hoped that D wouldn't hold a grudge against her for her yelling 
at him. He was a nice bot and she didn't want to scare him off.




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * D watched Fenox, her eyes unresponsive before she shook her head.
> His ears pressed flat against his skull as she rose her voice at 
him, 
> thinking that he was picking up an angry tone.
> Was he in trouble? He was only trying to help her.
> He whined and moved away from the door, nodding when she asked if 
that was 
> all he wanted to let her know.
> Fenox sounded impatient and annoyed with him, making him feel bad.
> If there was one thing that the people who created him could say, 
was that 
> his feelings were hurt easily.
> D wasn't use to bluntness, and was basically as helpless as a new 
born in 
> this world.
> Even though he held great power, he was shy in using it and was a 
kind 
> heart.
> But he still didn't like Vlad, though Fenox didn't seem to need him 
to 
> protect her or anything. So he wouldn't, since she knew what was 
going on.
> D sat down on his haunches and lowered his head, wating for Fenox 
to leave 
> the room first. Maybe making her leave Vlad alone out there was 
worse then 
> he thought.*
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
